newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Malan does not see Brazil hurt by Asia forex woes.
newsitem.headline: Malan does not see Brazil hurt by Asia forex woes.

text.p: Brazilian Finance Minister Pedro Malan said the recent currency devaluations in Southeast Asia could undermine investor confidence in emerging economies, but confidence in Brazil's economy would be strengthened by its specific characteristics, a newspaper said.

He said Brazil's current account deficit was not as high at four percent of gross domestic product (GDP) as that of the Philipines, Indonesia and Thailand whose current account deficits ranged between six to eight percent of GDP and made them vulnerable to currency speculation, Folha de Sao Paulo said.

Malan also cited Brazil's privatization program as a positive point, saying that the high price paid recently for B Band cellular telephone concessions showed that Brazil had huge potential for investment, Folha said. ((-- Simona de Logu, Rio de Janeiro newsroom, 5521 507 4151))
